alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 17 at 3:15PM EST until February 18 at 7:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain, snowmelt, and ice jams continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Cameron, Elk, McKean, Potter, Tioga and Warren. * WHEN...Through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff and possible ice jams may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
